response.title: Don't kill your language
response.speaker: Suzanne Talhouk
response.description: Suzanne Talhouk advocates for the preservation of her native language, Arabic. She connects the decline of language diversity with cultural loss and encourages the audience to embrace and preserve their language heritage.

response.title: Saving a language from extinction
response.speaker: Daniel Bögre Udell
response.description: Daniel Bögre Udell talks about how languages are a gateway to understanding cultures, histories, and perspectives. He discusses Wikitongues, a project dedicated to documenting and saving languages at risk of extinction.

response.title: Let's save the last 6,000 languages
response.speaker: Wade Davis
response.description: Anthropologist Wade Davis makes a poignant case for the preservation of language and cultural diversity. According to him, each language is an old-growth forest of the mind, a watershed of thought, an ecosystem of social and spiritual possibilities.

response.title: The Race to Save Endangered Languages
response.speaker: Gregory Anderson
response.description: Linguist Gregory Anderson shares the urgency in preserving endangered languages around the world. He discusses the systematic approach his organization takes to document, preserve, and revive languages that are on the brink of extinction.

response.title: A Call to Action for Language Preservation
response.speaker: Laura Welcher
response.description: Laura Welcher of The Long Now Foundation highlights the alarming rate at which languages disappear and why humanity needs to preserve linguistic diversity. She showcases initiatives that support communities in retaining their ancestral tongues.

response.title: Language as a Window into Human Nature
response.speaker: Steven Pinker
response.description: Psychologist Steven Pinker offers a fascinating look into language and how it expresses what goes on in our minds. While not exclusively tied to language diversity, it provides context for why understanding various languages offers insights into human thought.

response.title: Tech That Reveals What's Being Said in Sign Language
response.speaker: Jun Hui Tee
response.description: Jun Hui Tee presents cutting-edge technology that can translate sign language into spoken language in real-time, highlighting the need to communicate with the deaf community in their own language and the broader importance of language preservation.

response.title: Language as a gateway to human history
response.speaker: Mark Pagel
response.description: Evolutionary biologist Mark Pagel shares an intriguing theory about why humans evolved our complex system of language. He suggests language is a piece of 'social technology' that allowed early human tribes to access a powerful new tool: cooperation.

response.title: The secrets of learning a new language
response.speaker: Lýdia Machová
response.description: In her talk, Lýdia Machová unfolds the secrets of polyglots and shares how embracing the cultures behind languages can be the key to learning them effortlessly. She highlights the need to not just preserve endangered languages but to actively practice and keep them in use.

response.title: My wish: Protect our oceans
response.speaker: Sylvia Earle
response.description: While not directly related to language, Sylvia Earle's passionate plea for the protection of our oceans resonates with themes of preservation and the need to safeguard fragile ecosystems. Similarly, the drive to preserve endangered languages is about protecting the fragile ecosystem of human culture and knowledge.

response.title: The beauty of the Irish language
response.speaker: Padraig O'Ceithearnaigh
response.description: Padraig O'Ceithearnaigh delves into the poetic nature of the Irish language (Gaeilge), sharing his passion for its complex history, musicality, and the cultural identity it represents. His talk explores the language's struggle against declining use but also the burgeoning revival in both rural and urban areas in Ireland.

response.title: Reviving the Irish language
response.speaker: Siobhan Ni Dhuinnin
response.description: Siobhan Ni Dhuinnin shares her experience with the Irish language and the importance of its preservation in contemporary Ireland. She discusses educational initiatives and technology's role in breathing new life into Gaeilge. Her vision is one of a living language that evolves and thrives among the next generation.

response.title: The challenge and triumph of teaching Irish
response.speaker: Fionnuala Cloke
response.description: Fionnuala Cloke presents the unique challenges of teaching Irish, a language with fewer native speakers each year. She discusses innovative teaching methods to engage students, promote the language's everyday use, and ensure its survival and growth. Her work is proof of the language's resilience and cultural significance.
